abstract: The decision comes barely a month after Meg Whitman took over as chief executive, concluding a strategic review begun by her predecessor.
snippet: The decision comes barely a month after Meg Whitman took over as chief executive, concluding a strategic review begun by her predecessor.
lead_paragraph: Barely a month into Meg Whitman's tenure as chief, Hewlett-Packard announced on Thursday that it would not sell the company's dominant personal computer business -- closing off a strategic path offered by her predecessor.

headline.main: Hewlett-Packard to Keep Its PC Business
